description.narrative: Mercy Corps is partnering with the NoVo Foundation to strengthen our protection approach throughout our regional emergency response efforts in Syria and the surrounding countries. We see the opportunity to integrate protection principles into our programming that will work to reduce exposure to GBV for beneficiaries, to create pathways to support GBV survivors and to be intentional about working with girls through targeted beneficiary recruitment in an effort to balance the gender participation in youth and adolescent programming. Our work across the Syria response region will reach an estimated 2 million people by February next year, and of those 51% are assumed to be women and girls. We see a clear need for GBV prevention, referral and other protection mechanisms and welcome the NoVo Foundation's support to develop the right skill sets on our teams to provide this programming.

a. Building capacity of our teams to prevent, identify and refer GBV and protection cases b. Identifying trends and differences across our response effort and best practices to address these c. Capturing lessons learned through our efforts and communicating those organization-wide to influence Mercy Corps’ future emergency response efforts globally d. Offering GBV and protection training for our teams e. Setting up a referral mechanism in each of our Syria response countries that will include context specific identification and mitigation of critical concerns
